subject: Photography
title: The Decisive Moment
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Decisive Moment usable.

hook.text: Henri Cartier-Bresson called it 'the decisive moment' â€” the instant when subject, composition, and emotion align.

buildup.text: The concept suggests that within the flow of life, there is one perfect instant to press the shutter.

discovery.text: Recognizing the decisive moment requires intuition, training, and presence. It's the meeting of preparation and chance.

twist.text: The concept is controversial. Many great images are carefully composed, not caught. Planning can beat instinct.

climax.text: Whether you plan or react, timing is everything. The right millisecond separates a masterpiece from a near miss.

punchline.text: The moment exists for everyone. Only some are ready for it.

quiz.question: What is Cartier-Bresson's 'decisive moment'?
options: The instant when subject, composition, and emotion perfectly align
The moment you buy your first camera
The ideal time of day to shoot
